description: Lucked out on the craziness by ordering online. It was so simple got there and my food was ready for pick up. And they were on time not like other places where they forget or make it for you while you get there.
author: Poonam M.

description: Ridiculously small portion. Yet another disappointing experience at Chipotle. I just couldn't this time. The manager was nice enough to issue a refund but for $20 I expect a normal sized meal. I even asked for double steak and the photo is the result. The employee making my burrito bowl was doing the most to put the absolute least amount of food in the bowl. Please fire the girl that made my bowl. She had super thick glasses but not thick enough to see what a stingy b$&@? she was being.
author: Daniel R.

description: This is hands down the absolute slowest Chipotle I've ever been to in the entire city.
author: Kevin G.

description: You can never go wrong with chipotle when you are craving a mixture of vegetables and ingredients. I ordered the chicken bowl with a tortilla on the side and I am just so impressed with how fast the service was! I went around 12:30pm on a Tuesday so of course there was a lunch line rush but once it came to my order, it went by with the snap of my fingers (probably less than a 1 minute order!) I really like this place too because they were quite generous with the portions and and had friendly service. I ate in with my friends and we were also observing how one of the employees was making a burrito with such care. He put all the ingredients on the burrito and mixed it up instead of having one side overwhelmed with sour cream while the other side overwhelmed with rice. Very smart and thoughtful service to enhance the taste of the burrito. Overall, positive experience, quick service, tummy was very satisfied and clean interior.
author: Amy L.

description: They didn't have any soft taco shells.  You're a fast causal Mexican restaurant, how exactly do you run out of a staple item in the middle of the day?  When I asked how long they'd been out, they replied, "we're not sure, just didn't have any when we opened today."  Wait, what? As usual Chipotle finds new and different ways to disappoint their customers.
author: Jeff H.

description:
I usually come here during my lunch on the weekdays and it gets quite crowded. The workers are fast and polite! Best of all they don't skim on your portion size during rush hour (from my personal experience).

Special shout out to Jacob, the Take Out Specialist, for being so helpful and informing me about ordering online (so convenient!)
author: Ella C.

description: I dunno what's up with this location, I've been here several times and it's consistently terrible. I haven't had issue with the portion sizes, but holy crap all the meats here are the saltiest I've ever had at a Chipotle. Every single time the chicken tastes like the remnants of someone's attempt to make salt chicken jerky. The overall quality of the meat options at this location is also generally poor so the oversalting is probably a deliberate attempt to cover that up.
author: Andrew W.

description:
I usually don't give reviews to restaurant chains but I'm making an exception for this location.

The meat and beans were on the bottom of my burrito bowl, followed by the rice, salsa, cheese on top. I get that Chipotle is not fine dining but they shouldn't just plop everything lazily into the bowl.

I ordered online and still had to wait almost 10 mins in the pickup line.
author: Bryan H.

description: First time visiting a Chipotle in SF, and I must say that... it wasn't so bad. The one thing was that they didn't really give me a lot of rice or beans, but they did give me so much chicken I couldn't eat the whole bowl. The chips and guac were awesome, so that was a plus too!
author: G F.

description: Fresh, yummy food!  Awesome Staff specially Rebecca, long line for lunch but it goes fast
author: Malou S.

description:
At lunch, I'm the type that usually seeks out a unique food truck or will walk 10-15 minutes for a tasty hole-in-the-wall on the outskirts of the FiDi/SoMa.  I've noticed tons of office workers forming insanely large lines at Chipotle for years and finally decided to give it a try.  So the line itself took me roughly 17 minutes to get my burrito.  It rang up at $14.45 and that's *without* any chips or drink.  And worst of all, it was below mediocre, potentially one of the worst lunches I've had in years.

Carnitas & Steak Burrito w/ Guacamole: Anyone who rolls a burrito like this in San Francisco should be ashamed of themselves.  It was a halfhearted attempt to loosely close the sides together; no bunching the ingredients tightly together and no cleanly sealed roll.  I get that there is a good amount of filling, but burrito professionals in the Mission manage to work with similarly large burritos just fine.  For all the talk about fine ingredients, the meat wasn't that great.  The steak had a few gristly bites and the carnitas were very bland and without any sort of crispy texture.  The guacamole was a pretty stingy small clump, despite the upgrade fee.  The beans were nice though, probably the one highlight.  Had a bit of sticker shock at the register: $14.45.  For that price, you could eat like a king at any Mission taqueria (and they won't charge you for chips & salsa).
author: Adam B.

description: A pretty good quality Chipotle (compared to other locations in the area.) The interior is clean and maintained and the staff is friendly a majority of the time (we all have bad days) and the food is what you would expect out of a Chipotle. They don't skimp on the portions like a lot of other locations do which is a plus and the lines move fairly quickly. If you like and are familiar with the Chipotle brand then this location should fulfill your needs.
author: Ricky C.

description: What can I not say about Chipotle? I have been here on several occasions and the service has always been terrible. There's especially one employee who always seems to get things wrong even when I repeat the order several times to get it right. How hard could it be? I have had mixed orders or just wrong orders totally. It is despicable. Their chicken burrito bowl which I use to like has also lost its flavour over time and it just seems like they're not really bothered by the product that they put out. If I ever want Chipotle again I'll go to another location.
author: Jamie H.

description: Always a long line during lunch hours, but the line moves fairly quickly. The portions are smaller than normal :/ but it's probably because there's always so much people at this location, so they aren't very generous with the portions. I think the taste of everything is relatively the same - I usually get the burrito bowls. Maybe try the location near market street or Kearny for bigger portions :)
author: Bailey L.

description:
Chipotle is a chain I remember well from back before I was living "Down Under".  One recent evening I was craving Mexican food, so I decided to check it out again now that I'm back in the US.

My best recollection of the food here is their tasty, over-sized burrito, which was always reasonably priced.  That seem liked a good place to start :-)

I got the chicken burrito, which came with pinto beans, white rice, sour cream, fajita veggies. Mild, corn, and hot salsas.  Guacamole cost extra, but it's the holidays, so why not?  Over and above what the burrito comes with, I added some Tabasco sauce, which was the perfect compliment to a very satisfying dinner.

Tip: Order online so you can bypass the line and go right to the register.

I've passed by this location several times and seen it pack with people, but when I came in for dinner the other night it was virtually empty

Bottom line: Chipotle is a solid choice for a decent meal at a fair price - I'll be back again soon!
author: Crystal L.

description: Have to be the most fucking ripped off location ever. They hardly give any fucking meat when you order a bowl. I am never going to go back and give this fucking ridiculous location my money. And when you want them to add more meat they fucking hardly add any and want to charge you damn near $5 more for fucking what? I hardly see any meat in my steak bowl that I ordered. Really how do you guys train your people. If I could I would give this place negative 100. Other locations aren't greedy with giving more without an extra charge.
author: Michelle T.

description: DO NOT GO TO THIS LOCATION. The manager nick is a complete a**hole who goes online & makes death threats to random people whom he doesn't even know. It's hard to believe that a great establishment like this place would hire someone so confrontational. What if an angry customer upset him at work? & he's a manager? Are you kidding me? I wouldn't be surprised if he tries to make more threats towards me after this review, but I'm leaving this review to warn everyone so they don't have to deal with someone as horrible as him. Beware all.
author: Ashley H.

description:
They servers were very helpful and polite.

Usually at fast food they just want to take your order as quickly (and often rudely) as they can.

I gave the place a three star because there was garbage on the floor and it looked like the floor had never been washed. You know how nice the bathrooms are in a New York City Train Station? That's what the floors here reminded me of.

But I figure that is management's fault. Not the cheerful and polite workers.
author: James W.

description:
I was trying to figure out what to order for a lunch meeting at work, and Chipotle came up on my radar.  It turns out it's a great option, as long as you don't need delivery and can pick up the order.

Ordering couldn't have been simpler.  I called the 800 number the day before, specified the store, and ordered the 2 meat spread for 20 people.  Since we have a lot of vegetarians in the group, I substituted one of the meats for fajita veggies.

Pickup and setup was an absolute breeze.  The food was ready on time, and everything was put in big easy to carry bags.  They included stands, chafing dishes, and fuel to keep the food warm, as wells as pre-printed labels for each item.

I got back to the office and setup all the stuff - they included two kinds of rice, two kinds of beans, a bunch of different salsas, sour cream, guacamole, cheese, lettuce, chips, taco shells, and tortillas.

Everybody attending the meeting loved the setup, since they could make anything they wanted, whether it was a burrito bowl, fajita, taco, or salad.  And of course, it's Chipotle, so you know the food will be good!
author: Nadeem A.

description: Today I am not happy with the service provided by this particular Chipotle.  Not complaining about the food, just the server who was quite rude when I asked him a simple question.  Why are you rationing the vegetables?  I have never heard of this before.  But his answer was not kind and I think he forgot that the customer should be treated with respect.  I personally did not ask him in an abrasive way.  I was just surprised.   I also tried to ask him was it happening at all the Chipotle restaurants and his answer was very rude.  Guess I will walk a few blocks to another Chipotle for better customer service or not eat at Chipotle in the future.  Thinking about it especially when there is an authentic Mexican Restaurant around the corner.
author: Casandra B.

description:
Chipotle is now my go to spot for burrito and taco cravings. I was a little hungry after a workout session at 24 Hour Fitness. A meal that's fast but healthier was exactly what I am looking for and Chipotle has it. Two of the items I have tried were a burrito bowl and tacos. Nice spot for a good lunch. The line here may be long especially during lunch hour but it does move fast, seats are available inside and outside.

*burrito bowls - a new and excellent alternative, it's very delicious. For this item, I chose plain rice (cilantro-lime seasoned), black beans, chicken, shredded cheese and lettuce. I also tried the burrito bowl with carnita and it is delicious.

*tacos - it's bite size portions, easy to digest and also very delicious. This item, I chose flour tortilla (x3), chicken, shredded cheese and lettuce.

**Both items are absolutely delicious and I enjoyed it. I also like how their food is freshly prepared.

Rubric for rating:
- facility cleanliness (+1)
- friendliness of staff team (+1)
- seating available inside and outside (+1)
- prompt and courteous service (+2)

Overall, positive experience here so I'll definitely be back.

02/18/2015:
Grilled Chicken Tacos on Soft Corn Tortilla (x3) is absolutely delicious. I've enjoyed my meals at Chipotle and this is a great way to satisfy my Mexican food cravings. This is another go to restaurant for lunch in the Financial District.
author: Bennett W.

description:
Is it me or is Chipotle getting worse in terms of food quality and flavor?
The white rice at this branch is cooked horribly. Slightly undercooked, grainy, and lacking flavor. The pico de gallo (mild salsa/tomatoes) seem to be super watery and mushy here - bad tomatoes?
Same with the sofritas - oddly seasoned and super watery - drenched my salad w unnecessary extra liquid  content

Bleh - there so many other good options for Mexican food esp in cali

Lines are long here cause of all the corporate buildings nearby
author: Brenda L.

description: My colleague just tried to place an order for 22 burritos and you guys turned her down because there wasn't enough notice? There was only ONE customer in there. Smooth move chipotle! You're trying to win back customers after the latest food sickness and you pull this? Not coming back here again! Just go next door to Orale Orale, at least they have authentic food and some decency of customer service. Good job Chipotle
author: Albert H.

description:
My go-to, my safety net, my rock. Chipotle never disappoints. Consistant, quick for the days you don't have a lot of time,  and healthier (relatively) than most other options. Ingredients are clean and I like the fact that brown rice is an option now.  As the internet says "not all heroes wear capes". 

Usually I'll alternate between barbacoa and chicken burrito WITH guac (yes, I know it's extra. Why is this even a question?) black beans and brown rice. If I'm extra health conscious I'll get a bowl with the same. The chips have hints of lime, and the fact that all chipotles carry Tabasco sauce ( mild and hot) deserves a star on it's own in my book. 

Is it the best burrito in the world? No, but it's pretty damn good. Say what you want about "authenticity", this is not about that. I'm going purely on taste and quality here. Both areas where chipotle excels at. There is something to be said about how they have made clean food accessible ( especially in FiDi where a salad alone is 15 bucks) and how quickly they get through the massive lunch lines. Occasionally you'll run into someone who doesn't wrap your burrito right, or is stingy for a little more of something, but by far everyone I've encountered has been helpful and upbeat. 

I could not imagine living somewhere where there isn't a chipotle ( I did once for a year and I'll never go back). Even if I don't go all the time, it's nice to know I can fall back on it. 

This particular location is big, plenty of seating and even outdoor seating.
author: Thielson D.

description: I can't believe the reviews on here. This is fast food. It's CHEAP FAST FOOD in the city. The food is always good. The service is always great... for me but maybe that's because I'm nice to the people who work there. (Insert eye roll) Keep up the good work guys!
author: Amy B.

description: Back in March of 2017, I placed an online order, riding on MUNI, without realizing I forgot my wallet at home (and didn't have a saved payment method on my account). I called this location fully expecting to cancel my order, but the woman on my phone insisted I come in for a free meal. I was stressed, tired, and frantic, and already prepared myself to have to go hungry for the rest of the day due to my lack of payment. They were my angels that day, and said all they wanted in return was a positive review! Today, I'm living up to that promise. Thank you, you amazingly kind people!
author: Collette G.

description:
This Chipotle location is the by far the best! This particular review is to highlight the wonderfully cheery and kind-hearted cashier and Staff who helped me today (and has before).  Unfortunately, I do not have her name, but her infectious attitude must be acknowledged.

They open for business at 10:45 am and since I take my lunch at 10:35am  I'm in and out in under 6 min. Great customer service and great fresh food. Thank you! 










;45
author: Jose P.

description: By far the worst Chipotle I've ever been to. They short-change you on every single ingredient (especially meat) and are very rude to boot. The barbacoa also tastes like it's been sitting out for months. Avoid this location like the plague.
author: Adam M.

description: I came to this chipotle on a weekday afternoon. There was no line so service was fast. I ordered a steak bowl and thought the worker was skimpy on the filling. Other than that, I thought they were efficient and I was able to get on my way within 5 minutes.
author: Tabitha H.

description: Rude employees. The ingredients are salty as fuck and not fresh. They intentionally gave smaller portion size than other locations that I've been to. The workers there are so impatient that they'll just stare at you if you don't order quick enough. Fuck that, and I'll never be back.
author: Sasha D.

description:
This is one of my favorite locations, I was surprised to see the low rating. They have a long line and they bust through. Don't expect to be walking your way through fast but that's pretty good for a line that goes out the door! In fact this location is popular enough that I WOULDN'T recommend to go here because you'll be waiting in line a good ten or twenty minutes of your lunch break. I'm not sure really.
But the food is good. They have raised their standards since bad news broke about your potential of getting sick, are really careful, extremely clean--too clean, to the point where it just takes too much time off, are Grass Fed, and recently went completely GMO Free.

The guac is too expensive, ridiculous amount for a little paste. The music is played too loud, you have to really shout like.
author: M R.

description:
How good chipotle is depends on the time you go. If you go during lunch hour prepare yourself for a long line that is out the door. And then...wear a jacket because its cold in the shadows of these fidi buildings.
After lunch hour is prime time to go. The employees are so friendly, give you large portions, and are generally quick and efficient.
Also I am on a diet and chipotle is diet compliant: brown rice, chicken, guacamole. All for  less than $10. what a steal!
author: Julianna I.

description: The service is good- nothing spectacular. Burrito is so so.  Not my 1st choice but it will do.
author: Nae F.

description:
This is literally the worst chipotle I have ever been to, and I love chipotle. The staff was rude and put the wrong salsa on my bowl. When I told her I had asked for mild and not hot she told me I needed to "learn to speak up" um.... I'm an Italian from New York so I assure you I am not soft spoken. The place was really loud and you had to yell over the sneeze guard but somehow that wasn't the reason she didn't hear me, like its my fault? Then she just throws my bowl in the garbage and literally slams my guacamole down hard on the counter. It was ridiculous I was so shocked. I would have told management but I had to go to an appointment after. 
Usually chipotle is a good experience and the staff is friendly but this bitch ass lady was very disgruntled. 
Oh and the sink in the bathroom didn't work and a (nice) employee told me it had been broken for 2 months.
author: Pilar J.

description: Thank you Chipotle for massive digestive distress and diarrhea. I was feeling great before grabbing dinner this afternoon. Been in and out of my bathroom for the last few hours hoping I don't discharge in my pants. I kind of wish I could get my money back and use it to buy some medicine, but I'll just leave with the promise I'll never patronize any Chipotle in the future in fear of a 50/50 chance of having explosive diarrheal rounds in the restroom that burn with large excrements of stomach acid in tow. I'm hoping I won't become nauseous or too dehydrated from the loss of fluids as I'd like to not miss work to goto the hospital. Well done guys, thanks for the disappointment.
author: Alex R.

description: Not as good as they used to be. And of course a bit pricey. Paid $14 for a burrito with only rice, beef, steak and sour cream!
author: Omid A.

description:
The staff there have gone downhill. I had to repeat every single item I asked for at least twice. I was practically yelling and pointing at what I wanted and somehow I would still get asked if I wanted something other than what I was asking for. At one point it went like this:

Her: Do you want brown or white rice?
Me: BROWN RICE PLEASE (while pointing)
Her: Hey (to the chick next to her), do you want to take care of the salsa? (or something like that).
Chick next to her: mumbles something.
Her: Just a moment, please. (to me) and then mumbles something back to the chick. (Then back to me) ma'am, would you like Brown Rice or White Rice?
Me: BROWN RICE! (pointing again)
Her: mumbles something to the chick. Then to me she says, I'm sorry, Brown Rice?
Me: YES BROWN RICE BROWN RICE BROWN RICE!!!!!!!!!!

That basically sums up my entire ordering experience. What is up with you people. If you need a few minutes to regroup and discuss something, fine, but don't make me have to ask for the same thing 4 times! 

I can see why your line was moving at a snails pace. Work it out.
author: Noneya B.

description: It's Super Bowl weekend, this place is CRAZY and the staff is still going above and beyond for their customers. Special shout out to VERONICA! She was so friendly and gracious to every person here. I know how crazy it can be working on hectic days like this, and she had such a positive attitude the whole time. Plus the food was extra YUM. Thanks Veronica and Chipotle, we'll see you again soon!
author: Marissa M.

description: I come to this location at least 2-4 times a month and every time the service is outstanding. The Manager (maybe Asst Mgr?) gets to know the names and orders of his "regulars" and takes care of them dearly. Shout of to Scotty for such a great location!
author: Jessalyn D.

description: My fav chipotle location. The staff are always friendly and they flow right through the longest lines. The food is always great and the seating arrangement is nice as well. You can sit out in the main area or privately in the back behind the napkins and utensils. Not to mention on really nice days you can sit outside.
author: Veronica S.

description:
*Update*

If you want to eat real Mexican, you know, the kind that comes with Carnitas, there is a great place called "Tlaloc" just a couple of blocks up the street here - http://www.yelp.com/biz/tlaloc-san-francisco

Unlike Chipotle, there's real Mexican's working here!!! Ya, and they know what good Mexican food is supposed to taste like, not the weird Vegan garbage version offered at sad sad Chipotle, yup they carry everything, including Carnitas.
author: Grace S.

description: The food is good but Horrible customer service.!! Rude people if you don't like your job find something better to do..!!!
author: Angel S.

description:
This might sound crazy to some, but, this is the first Chipotle I've ever gone to. With plenty of authentic tacquerias I've never felt the need to go to Chipotle. But, FiDi is a different matter. As much as people hate on Chipotle, it's really not that bad especially considering the other Mexican options in FiDi which tend to suck. The chips are gross, but, the burrito bowls are pretty delicious.  

The meh part is the staff. They are kinda weird, and sometimes for the burrito bowls their beans/meat to rice ratio is way off, but, they'll usually do another scoop of whatever if you ask. Also, the lines here can get crazy long, even after the typical lunch rush. Chipotle is good, but, not wait in a ginormous line good.
author: Paige C.

description: BEST MEXICAN FOOD IN THE CITY.  Convenient, fairly priced and semi healthyish. Best part, free napkins, Tabasco and soda all day(just ask for water cup). Downfall, long line but moves quickly
author: Marcus S.

description:
Can't expect everything to always be perfect, but at least the workers here are fast and friendly. I wanted Chipotle for weeks now, and I wasn't really disappointed. The only thing that annoyed me was that my burrito was wrapped lose, when I took off the foil it basically fell apart. Other than that it still tasted good. I love the chips here, which they would put more in the bag since you pay for that separately. 
The line here is usually out the door but it moves pretty fast.
author: Irma R.

description: Something is wrong with the way this location is managed. The food is tasteless. There is a lack of caring about the product. , the tables are dirty and there is an overall uncleanliness about the place. I predict the next Chipoltle food poisoning will come from this location.
author: Steven B.

description:
Standard food, but super slow. Hire more ppl, and get the lines moving. 

Doesn't seem complicated, and get they are trying to lower costs, but can't wait in line for this.
author: Dan K.

description: Woo to yet another Chipotle in downtown SF! I've not gotten food poisoning yet! Lines are long during weekday lunchtimes, sometimes it moves quickly. Other times it tests your resolve to get Chipotle~
author: Mingmei N.

description:
I'm glad to see there is a consistent pattern to the crappy service at this location. Not that I've experienced amazing service at many other Chipotles, but this one just happens to get my review today. 

I'm pretty sick and tired of ordering a burrito and watching the person that wraps up sit there and struggle with what they know to be too much to fold in a burrito.  The end result is a thing wrapped in foil that can only be compared to a baby's dirty diaper, waiting for you to open it up and have it dump all over your lap. Pun intended. 

Today I went there, ordered a burrito from the guy with no hat on and hair in his face beyond his eyes. And he kept flipping his head around to keep it back too. Might as well have just sprinkled hair all over the meat while he was at it. I'm sure someone gets to eat his hair today. Everyone else had on Chipotle hats, why not this weirdo?

After ordering all of my ingredients the girl that was folding it up struggled and struggled and then she grabbed another piece of foil to just make sure it closed. I saw this all going down and just let it happen. As I rang out I asked the girl to give me a bowl, because I know what I was going to be experiencing back at my office desk. 

And sure enough, when I got back and pulled back an inch or two of foil I was met with falling onions and tomatoes. I revealed more and could now see an entire cross-section of my burrito exposed under foil. How the hell would I eat this in burrito form had I not grabbed a bowl as a backup?

Morons. Train your people how to make the product they are serving.

Sorry to be harsh, but this is not the first surprise burrito explosion I've gotten.

Oh yah, my chips are stale as hell today too, that is a first. They feel like they were wet and then dried out.
author: Mack L.

description: I had the worst experience ever at this location!!!! Do not come here unless you want to get terrible service! The associates were rude, and when I asked for a cup for water, they told me that they were out of water cups. It was only 11:15am when I went there so how can you be out of water cups?! I didn't even want to eat there anymore. Just the worst experience I ever had from any Chipotle that I've been to. I rather walk a few blocks to a different location. Terrible.
author: Iris L.

description: Poor service. Felt as if server didn't want to make my salad and when I requested her to top off w lettuce, she seemed annoyed. Didn't receive salad dressing w my order either.
author: kelz p.

description:
This is the best burritos in the Fi-Di. I never thought I'd say that but here we are. It's a dark day. 

If you've never spent time here likely you have misguided perceptions. The food sucks for the most part in the FiDi and everybody knows it. Still, almost every restaurant has a huge line and if it doesn't then the food is practically inedible.

Chipotle is fresh, fast and organized. This is the only place, from this day forward I will get a burrito from when at work.
author: Justin S.

description: I came by to get a quick bite and Bacca was amazing. I unfortunately only had $100 bill and didn't realize they no longer excepted $100s so she told me the meal was on them. I wasn't expecting to get anything free so I was really blown away when she told me. Excellent service fast and friendly crew I'll assume she is a service manager or kitchen manager because she was quick thinking and really took good care of me.
author: Adrian C.

description:
WORST PORTION SIZES EVER! They barely give you any food & give you attitude when you ask for just a little more. If I'm going to pay $7- $9 for a bowl or burrito, I want an actual bowl or burrito filled with food! 
Do yourself a favor & don't come to this location anymore. Not worth the wait, not worth the money. Throughly disappointed, since I know other Chipotles will give you better portions. Not going back to this location ever again!!
author: Amy K.

description: I've come here after work a few times to take an order to go and it's really great when it's not busy during lunch time. The workers are normally very polite and its fast and delicious! I will continue to come here regularly.
author: Richard L.

description: They have 4 person in the back but only 1 person serve the costumer. And that person not nice too!!! In the back some guy cut the beef just cook. And i asking nicely that i want that beef.. because  the one in out side is dry and look very sad!!! And he say NO to me!!! What kind the costumer service?? Never have that experience before in any chipotle store.. love chipotle but not in that store!!!
author: Alik L.

description:
I LOVE Chipotle to the point where it is probably an unhealthy addiction considering how many calories there are in the chips alone.  The chips are so, so tasty though. 

This location always has a long line during weekday lunch break so I recommend using the online ordering option.  The servers are friendly and accommodating, and the restaurant is clean and has an outdoor seating area.  

This is my go-to "fast food" spot on busy work days for sure!
author: Sumeena B.

description:
Honestly, I would not be able to do lunch-time workouts if it weren't for this Chipotle. 

You can pre-order online, schedule a pick-up on the 15-minute increment, skip the regular line, and be in and out the door with your food within a couple minutes. It's even faster than having to wait in line for the microwave at my office.

Great, friendly staff! Healthy fast food! yay.
author: Amy D.

description:
I adore this place! Every employee that I  have engaged with is so warm, friendly and welcoming. Scott and Rick are a stellar management team. They are very astute - I appreciate how they know my order before I  walk in the door. I feel like I am Norm from cheers. :)

 In addition, the food is consistently  fresh and  delicious. The line during the lunch hour  appears long, but this incredible team powers through it quite quickly and impressively.   It should  go without saying that this  location is also super clean and attractive.

 This is a top notch location that I  believe is indebted to a high caliber team. Great people are hard to find and this location is concentrated with a friendly and passionate  team that all deliver great service. I am so happy to give my money to this location almost everyday of the work week.
author: Susan Z.

description:
Not sure what the massive hype is about Chipotle.  I'd much rather go to Orale-Orale or Tlaco (sp?) than have a burrito from them.  We order food from them at lunch all the time, and it's pretty boring.  

However!  Their chips are unbelievable!  Light, tasty and just the right amount of salt.  I could eat a big bag all by myself.  They actually remind me of the chips that Chevy's has, which were always my standard for restaurant chips.
author: .Hon H.

description:
Everyone always has the same brilliant idea as I do. They sit at their desks and daydream about the delicious burrito they'll have for lunch that will power them through for the rest of the day. They wait until 1:30 or even 2 and think, "Oh, everyone will have gotten lunch already and there will be no line!" Then they gallop over and lo and behold, there is the world's longest line awaiting you.

But this Chipotle is worth it. They are constantly refilling all the ingredients, and they are very, very generous with the guac, which is a rare and beautiful thing. The only problem is that it's a little hard to find, because it's hidden behind a large hotel, but otherwise, a great place for lunch...if you're willing to wait.
author: Christina S.

description: If you want to waste your entire lunch waiting for a sub par burrito this is the spot to go. I ordered online and did not get my burrito for 25 minutes after my pick up time. The line is no better, but it probably would have been faster if I just waited in line. I've been going to chipotle for YEARS and this location is consistently a disaster.
author: Alec B.

description:
ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE!   

I am a big Chipotle fan and everyone associated with this particular restaurant should be ashamed of themselves.  Rice and meat were served COLD!  Tortilla tasted like it was old.  And they did not even know how to roll a burrito. 

This is in no way a bad review for Chipotle in general, this is a review on this location.  Do not go!  Do yourself a favor and walk up to the location nearby on Market so you do not go through the insanely disappointing experience I just went through.
author: Ken V.

description:
I had avoided this place after seeing the negative reviews here..but finally decided to try it today. I placed my order online--one burrito and one burrito bowl with all the specific  fixings..and picked them up in 15 minutes. 
I went straight up to the counter --didn't have to wait in the long line. The food was chipotle standard and the portions were huge. 

Definitely will make this my weekly rotation.
author: Mimi T.

description:
Awesome Chipotle location. Very clean and with plenty of outside seating for sunny days. 

Expect a mega-line between 11:45 and 1:00 Monday through Friday when what seems like half the FiDi shows up, but it moves fairly speedily.

Great customer service as well. After ordering online with a large group and then having to wait 15 minutes past our scheduled pickup, management comped the entire order!
author: Matt F.

description: I never write reviews but it's time...  This location is the worst in SF!!!  Let start with lunch...  Used to be the hot spot- hot food and fast lines.  What happened??? Now it takes forever!!  Went for dinner tonight at 8pm - those guys had only 1 thing on their mind - closing!!  The food was cold!!  I think chicken, meat should be at a certain temp - is that right?  Do you check??  Went to soda machine - Coke Zero was out, and no carbonation for other drinks...  Don't get it!!!  I live and work a few blocks away / think it's time to find another place to eat...  Sad - chipotle used to be one of my favorite spots.  These guys should go to a location in LA - now those guys know how to do it....
author: Gregg S.

description: The burrito is really good. It's just that they give way to little meat for the price they charge. But overall It's really good.
author: Kevin P.

description: I'm a big fan of Chipotle and I have often gone to the Kearny Street or 525 Market Street locations (love both) but a recent change of gym brought me to this 50 California location. What a dreadful Chipotle. On 2 different visits (over a 1-week period) I have waited 10-15 minutes for the chicken to be ready and there was no mild salsa, corn salsa, or guacamole. Worse, the staff are so busy chatting with each other about their personal lives that they have no idea what you've said or what you want (and they really don't seem to care about anything).  I'd rather walk to the Mission to grab my burrito than ever step foot in this location again.
author: Edward R.

description:
I love the line here during lunch times. It's the only time of the day I can actually go outside and see people, and Chipotle doesn't disappoint.

Come here between 12-1 and you are sure to see a huge line that curves around the inside of the place. Poor customers who wanted to dine in and have a nice, quiet, peaceful lunch instead get to be at the center of all these random people waiting patiently to get a taste of Chipotle Mexican food.

There are 2 stages of line waiting here. Stage 1 is that the line is normal Chipotle line length and ends before the main entrance. If it is Stage 1, you can expect to wait under 10 minutes for your food. Stage 2 is that the line extends past the main entrance so that you enter and actually have to walk 10-20 feet left towards the soda machines/bathroom to find the end of the line. In Stage 2, you can expect to wait ~15-20 minutes for your food.

Not much to say about the food -- it's Chipotle! And you can find one almost anywhere in the Bay Area nowadays, all with the same menu. The only thing that matters is how you can get the most out of the servers in each restaurant. There are notoriously stingly Chipotle's (e.g. next to UC Berkeley on Telegraph), and there are some really generous Chipotle's that stuff your burritos/bowls to the max (e.g. Cupertino on Steven's Creek). 

This Chipotle (which Yelp says is on California Street but the entrance I always enter from is on Sacramento street) is about average. They tend to initially give portions on the smaller end, but when I ask them for some more they have always obliged and increased the quantity a decent amount. So make sure to ask! Or even better, go search on Google for an article about how to get the most bang for your buck when ordering from Chipotle. It is an art that I am merely adept at. I hope that someday I will be able to hone my skills and become a master. Until then, this shall end my review. Salutations.
author: Eric S.

description:
Okay, now I haven't been to a Chipotle in probably 2 years, but I actually remembered it being pretty high quality, simple and fast. It seems like in the last two years they've made a major cost reduction in the quality of the food, the chicken was actually quite fatty, which is really odd for this type of chopped up chicken. I feel like in the past it was of a much higher quality, and possibly even white meat only.  In addition the carnitas actually were so salty that I couldn't even finish them. Overall, I'm very disappointed in the quality of the food, which is the reason they get a low rating. There are many newer places, especially in this area that serve up traditional foods in interesting ways with good quality and modern trendy ingredients. There is really just no reason to go to Chipotle when you can go 100 feet in any direction and get better food for a similar price. Needless to say, I won't be back anytime soon.

I will add just one positive comment, the staff here is pretty friendly and seems to do a real good job considering the low quality product they have to deal with coming from corporate.
author: Cameo W.

description:
When I see the line that stretches out the door here during the weekday, I'm spurned to head on over to Safeway to get myself a sandwich or something. I came in here after my workout and it was super duper empty. Yay for me!

EDIBLES:

Chicken Super Burrito (brown rice, corn, pico de gallo, chicken, black beans, cheese, sour cream)

Next time I'm gonna cut out the sour cream because mid way through, I ended up using a spoon for this. In under 5 minutes, it became chicken tortilla soup in foil. Almost felt like I was camping and eating cold soup. 

SERVICE:

MEH. Typical fast food joint that's comparable with Mickey D's. No change.
author: Jason C. J.

description: Always really long lines during lunch, however, it moves quite fast, counter ppl are friendly bunch. I hit this place on average once aweek.
author: Séamus C.

description:
Great place. Quick kind staff that kept cooking every thing fresh and really emphasized good service. 

Coming back often.
author: Wayne B.

description:
Gives a lot of cheap filler, not much actual proteins or more 'expensive' things like guac.

Order has been messed up in some way more than once.
author: Dylan N.

description: Overpriced mediocre burritos. Cantina Verde is better and costs less. This place was better 2 years ago.
author: Gary P.

description: Haven't been back here for a while because every time I get a "bowl" the rice (both the white and the brown) is undercooked and crunchy.  A few times I've been in and the staff is so absorbed with their friends they get the order wrong, or don't even bother to do their job and waste my time.  For a chain store, it ain't bad.
author: Kai T.

description:
It just sucked!  Food was cold.  I watched a guy pick food off the stainless steel prep table behind the counter and just graze.  Someone (obviously an friend) was talking to an employee in the back from the line so they were not using their inside voices to have a conversation.  

If I am hungry for a burrito, I'll take a 12 minute ride on BART to the mission or La Corneta in Glen Park.   Authentic, better service, and support local business other than a chain restaurants that bastardize cuisine.
author: Guy S.

description:
If you looked up "chaos" or "disorganization" in the dictionary, you would find a picture of this store.

Ordered online, pick-up time was at 12:00.  Paid online.  Should be a breeze to pick-up, right?  Not here.

Knowing they'd be busy, I came at 12:10.  Yet, I still had to stand at their chaotic store for 20 minutes, while the guy who seems to maybe be a "manager" screamed and it was so crowded that everyone was knocking into each other.

How is it that Specialty's makes the online ordering and the pick-up process so easy (in and out in less than 15 seconds) and I end up spending half an hour just trying to pick up from Chipolte?

Never again.
author: B D.

description: Line is always super long BUT if you call ahead they have your order waiting for you & you can bypass the line. Friendly staff. Clean store. Close to everything.
author: Chayla G.

description:
Ghetto Attitude & Service, 
Stingy portions of un-fresh ingredients, 
Questionable food hygiene practices
wind tunnel interior. 
And the ghetto staff even have a tin out for tips... yeah right. 

Gee, welcome to crap service for poor quality food delivered to you by entitlement and ghetto attitude. 

Just as well I've been to the one on Montgomery which is the antithesis of this experience on every dimension. 

Yes I even went to the trouble of calling the 'Manager' of this Chipotle on California to complain & got the usual tirade of excuses and 'I don't care'. 

And I'm not rating my experience on being lined up @ peak time, this was early afternoon, there was maybe 15 people in there @ most.
author: Steve L.

description: They skimped on everything in my burrito bowl. Literally everything. And they asked if i wanted chips and a drink like 3 times. The one on O'Farrell is way better.
author: Richard M.

description:
I love the food but not the experience.

Due to the method they use for taking orders, placing an order for more than once person becomes difficult and holds up the line.  Even with a single order, the first few visits can feel a little daunting as they rush you through while trying to keep the line moving.  That's goes for any Chipotle.

As for this specific location, I have found the staff to be extremely friendly.  My biggest complaints about this location is how loud they play the music.  When I have gone with co-workers, I find myself having to almost yell across the table to be heard.  It is also extremely cold inside.  I'm sure the high ceilings and doors at opposite ends of the restaurant don't help.  I always need to where my coat while inside and I still find myself shivering.

My recommendations:  Turn down the music.  Turn up the heat.
author: Nicholas G.

description: Services Sometimes good and sometimes very bad. Sometimes the servers do not put enough food and have to ask for more fair amount
author: Albert T.

description: The last few times I was there I got half a burrito bowl. They look at you like "what's the problem." If I pay for food I like to get what I pay for.  I posted pics my lunch, but I'm not sure how they show. This is the only location i've seen them do this. If you're on a diet and don't want too much food go there. When I walk out of my gym next door I'm hungry. Half a bowl doesn't do it. I'll be going somewhere else from now on. What they seem to forget is that it's my money and if you don't give me what I'm paying for, I won't be giving you my business.
author: Anthony C.

description:
If you get here after 12, you will be waiting for a good amount of time. Luckily, I got here before the rush and I was attended to within 5 min. Not bad for a chipotle smack dab in the middle of the financial district. 
The workers are nice considering the fact that they're busy. I look for smiles and that's what I seen when I came in. Definitely will be coming here during lunch while I'm training in the city.
author: Jerrold M.

description:
If I could give more than 5 stars, I would! 

I was stuck at work late on a Friday, and wanted something healthy for dinner. I headed to the closest Chipotle, developing a stronger craving for a chicken burrito bowl with every step. 

After ordering my burrito bowl, though, I got to the front of the line and realized I'd forgotten my wallet at home!

The staff was so kind, and the lady at the cash register immediately said it was no problem. The man who made my bowl said, "Chipotle takes care of its customers," and I have never felt that more true as I walk back to my office to finish my work and devour my delicious burrito bowl!
author: Lauren S.

description: i had never visited this location & have been to many other chipotles. I ordered a veggie burrito bowl & when the person put the fajita veggies on there were barely any so I asked for more (not like I was ordering meat or something that costs extra!) and the lady whom was making my order seemed highly annoyed. My bowl is mostly full of rice and not much else. Super disappointed in this location.
author: A O.

description:
Super duper amazing service. 

We inquired about the tofu sofrito.  Even though they have not started serving it at this location until next week, the manager came our and made up sofrito burritos with some of the mix they had for the staff to sample.  

The Manager spent time telling us about the tofu and where it came from, etc.  SUPER AMAZING!

Burrito was great.  That said, I would return just for this service!
author: pete c.

description: So when I'm sitting around clueless,  wondering what to do for lunch here is where I head to. The veggies bowl or the sofritas bowl are my go to dishes and my hubby dashes for the double chicken bowl. Super convenient location but skip the car and just walk. The lines get LONG between 11.30-12.45 but it always moved fast coz of the express service and magically there is always place to sit. Me likey!
author: Shruti D.

description: Was in store 16 minutes before I had my food, during lunch hour. Servers violated 3 health codes while handling my burrito. Again, when you ask for a little they added an extra scoop rather than half. The cashier kept wiping her nose bare handed while handling food and money. And I just pulled inedible food product from my burrito which, again, is falling apart because they fold it like a piece of paper.
author: Billy D.

description:
My fav fake Mexican food :)

pretty busy.... download the iPhone app and you should be safe
author: Jackz C.

description: Don't eat here in the evening if you are hungry.  After not having the chance to take lunch today, I ran over to Chipotle--starving!  I ordered a Bowl and was served a half a spoon of rice, chicken--let's just say it was all small.  I think the guy working behind the counter must "own" the joint as he was trying hard not to give too much.  Having eaten at Chipotle enough, this was about 1/3 to a 1/2 of what you would get at another time.  I could see the bottom of the bowl along the sides when they put the cover on...I am still hungry no less....McDonalds perhaps!
author: James R.

description:
First time going to Chipotle and thought that the food was pretty good. I've always put off going to this place just because I grew up in the Mission in San Francisco and I know what authentic Mexican food taste like.
It is't your ordinary authentic Mexican burrito shop, the food that I ordered (chicken bowl) was great. Everything was fresh and the size of the bowl was perfect.

I'd definitely come back. Make sure to avoid the rush hour since the line can get really long.
author: Anna P.

description:
This is the worst Chipotle I've ever been to.  No effort is put into making your meal at all, they just slop everything together as messy and wet as possible.  I had to eat my tacos with a fork.

This location is across the street from my office so I've gone 3 or 4 times since they opened.  I've had the same mediocre experience each time.
author: Brandon R.

description:
so, I have to say... I probably would've given less stars for the way the burrito was so clumsily wrapped... but the service completely made up for it.  The very energetic man behind the counter was so friendly and bubbly from the second I walked in. He really made all the difference in the experience. 

The food is exactly what you expect from Chipotle, no disappointments.
author: Dayna E.

description: One of my usual food places. But the wait is long anywhere near lunch hours. They don't let you change the menu items much. Wish they had in between sizes or smaller options. Decently fresh meat and condiments.
author: Alex S.

description: Undercooked rice, small portions, & often make mistakes. This is not your best chipotle.
author: Randy L.

description: I just went to this Chipotle for the first time in San Francisco and they put way too much filling in my burrito (especially the salsa and corn) and it was falling out when they tried to wrap it up.  The lady was going WAY too fast and wasn't even listening to me when I said 'just a little salsa please' and drenched the burrito.  After 5 minutes in the bag, it had leaked through the foil and paper bag and in my purse. Come on Chipotle, listen to your customers. Waste of money.
author: Beth T.

description: This Chipotle is the worst. They had me stand in line to wait for fajitas for 20 minutes of my short lunch break. Then they messed up and put the wrong meat in. I will not return.
author: Max R.

description:
5 for first review!

this place just opened, so expect a little delay in the line. around 11ish the line was out the door and down the block. the interior is pretty interesting, and they place out tables to the side.

best part - open til 10, for all of us stuck at work through evenings.
author: Alvin D.

description: This location essentially completes the trilogy of Chipotle locations in the Financial District. I looove how spacious this one is after works. Uh huh.
author: Mel G.

description: It's not traditional Mexican, but it's fresh, tastes great, and cheap.
author: A R.

description:
Not sure what to say about the food...it's Chipotle, you probably know what you're getting. However, what I don't like about it is the location combined with the always open doors. This results in a wind tunnel that insures it will always be cold no matter what the outside temperature (which usually isn't that high to begin with because, well, SF). The couple of times I've eaten here instead of taking a burrito with me I've wound up freezing my butt off.
All that being said, glad to have this available closer to my office so I don't have to schlep down to Montgomery for my fix.
author: Pat M.

description: This chipotle totally skimps out on all the items they add to your burrito/bowl. Most of the time I can't even finish half of my item, but when I come to this location, I can eat it all in one sitting - I'm not a big girl either! After two bad experiences, this location has lost my business.
author: Lina M.

description:
So many haters! Yea around lunch rush you may have to wait  but just that's how all places are around the fidi! Chipotle is bomb.com consistently anywhere you go really and I think the smaller portions are happening all ALL Chipotles--especially compared to the newborn baby-sized burritos that they used to make back in the day with 2 days worth of calories in them. My waistline welcomes the smaller portions because I'm someone who will eat it all just because it's there. I'm also a fan of the option to have brown rice now.

In fact, Im going there right now.
author: An-Nhien L.

description: Chipotle is always yummy! But sometimes the people working there can " mess up the experience ". On several occasions I have gotten the rude response, lack of good customer service and some people look unkept with poor Hygiene. There was a guy literally talking right over my tacos practically yelling. Not being cognizant of the fact he may be spitting on my food. Also, Hair nets??? I found a piece of long hair in my tacos once. Overal I would say it's good but I think some people thete need a boost of happiness or just need to get a different job...
author: Adam R.

description:
This is a fine Chipotle. The people behind the counter seem very harried ("HISIRWHATWOULDYOULIKEOKTHANKYOUBYE") as they pass you on. Portions were fine, about what'd you expect from a downtown Chipotle. Food was fresh, though I did go during lunch rush - I'd be shocked if it wasn't.

Not getting into the merits, authenticity, or societal impact of Chipotle in this review - you know what you're getting into when you step inside.
author: Rohan N.

description: This new location caters to FiDi employees - the line gets very long during lunch hours. The employees are fast and efficient though. The location is also very bright and clean - certainly stop by if Chipotle is what you're craving.
author: Jocelin L.

description:
Among one of the worst Chipotles I have been to. The rice is consistently poor quality and the sauces look sad (where's the colour in the tomatoes???). The servers try to cheap out on quantity in such appalling ways. They should clearly know I like rice, but they try to get away with less than a spoonful on my bowl? So sad. 

I can say this confidently (how do you know it wasn't just a bad day? etc), because I have been to this one probably 90+ times in the past 6 months. There was a month where I ate at this chipotle every day for dinner, and occasionally lunch. 

NOTE: 525 Market street Chipotle is a better one, and that is my new dinner spot.
author: Chris C.

description: Line is huge but it moves fast. They do a great job! Mmmm Chipotle!! The spicy tofu gets two tumbs up from me!
author: Jessica H.

description: Really a great burrito.  Things that annoy me...no salsa bar, no chips included with your burrito, and $2 for guacamole on your burrito.  A lunch her can get a lot more expensive than you thought it would.  Other than that good quality.
author: Josh G.

description:
Omg, ever since I started working in this area, I've dreamt about eating Chipotle...and heartbroken that the nearest one was blocks away on Market. Imagine my extreme happiness to discover that a Chipotle would be opening ACROSS THE STREET. I loudly proclaimed that I would be eating all my meals here.

Now that the Chipotle has opened and I've been here a good number of times, but...this just isn't as good as other Chipotles, and I chalk it up to the inexperienced employees. This is the ONLY time where I can go up to order and say: Can I have a chicken burrito bowl to go with white rice and black beans? and have them not remember ANY part of that except for the "burrito bowl". Honest, they ask me again if it is to go, what kind of rice and beans I want, and what kind of meat I wanted. I understand if they don't remember EVERYTHING I said, but wow...you'd think that they'd remember SOMETHING. The first time I was here, they also got my coworker and my orders mixed up and handed us each a bag with the wrong order inside. And...maybe I'm just spoiled by the Chipotle in Berkeley that had the whole process down speedy and efficient, but I definitely don't expect to be held up at the register as the cashier tries to ring up my food.

I have high hopes once the employees start to shape up.
author: Melody L.

description:
I've been to many Chipotle locations in the city, and this one by far, is the best. It's close to my work and the gym. Staff is friendly. Food is just as good as you'd expect from Chipotle so I don't have much to say there. Portions are very generous. Yes the place's always packed, and the line can sometimes reach the outside. Well, it's packed for a reason. People like it, so do I. I wouldn't take a star off.

Overall a great place to eat at. If you want the best bang for your buck, look no further.
author: Mike T.

description: Compared to the other Chipotle's around the area and really, just a normal person's appetite - this location is STINGY with all of the ingredients. My rice didn't even cover the bottom of my burrito bowl, my friend got a pinch full of barbacoa, and my other friend didn't have any meat in the other half of his burrito.  For being so new, I thought they'd want to entice customers to come back, but I won't be going back to this location anymore.  Don't get me wrong, Chipotle is one of my favorite restaurants, but this location is getting a negative review.
author: Leslie C.

description: We tried out the new Chipotle on California Street and left wondering if this chain has over expanded and lost touch.  All the employees were Chinese, odd for a Mexican fast food joint.  Everyone's food was cold and bland.
author: Brian H.

description:
I work in this building and every day my coworkers and I would look at the "coming soon " sign, then we would admire the construction guys with their drills and hammers, hammering, plastering, drilling away, then we would observe the Chipotle workers being trained, then someone in my office looked up their alcohol license to see how it's going. Geesh! You'd think we had stake in this company! 
When Chipotle finally opened their doors a few weeks ago (I wasn't invited to their soft opening which was by invite only - HMPH!) the long, long lines began. Really, has no one ever eaten at a Chipotle before? It's a burrito for God sakes. 
Expect lines from 11am-3pm. I walk past there every day to get into my building and there is at least 3 people at the counter. At least  Orale Orale around the corner can take a break! 
Service is no super fast (considering the workers are still new) but both times I have been asked if I want more chicken for my burrito!  Yes, folks I still eat burritos. Not a big fan of the bowl! Bowl just seems messy to me! I don't pay $2 for the guacamole. That seems a little high for a dollop of it. Chips are extra too. 

I do like Chipotle and will go because it is literally downstairs from my office. I like the late hours which did come in handy when my coworker and I were headed to happy hour event and wanted to eat our burritos in the cab on the way there. 

Outside seating available.
author: Lauren W.

description: Just like any other Chipotle.  Same stuff different place.  The service was ok, kinda busy for 1:30, but not terrible.  The portions here are adequate, but had to ask for extra stuff cause the server was being a little stingy, but not as bad as the guy on Market St.  I could go on a tangent here, but I'll digress.  Will probably end up back here at some point since work is down the block.  I eat Chipotle too much regardless if the service is good or bad and this place isn't horrendous enough to not come here.
author: Jeremaine R.

description: I normally have very positive things to say about Chipotle. Most of the restaurants I've been to are fairly consistent in terms of food quality, service, and portions. However, this location needs serious improvement. I ordered a veggie burrito bowl to go and was shocked at the portion they gave me - only about a forth of the bowl was filled and it was mainly rice, which was undercooked. Maybe it was because I ordered it online, but I was definitely disappointed.
author: Alya G.

description: Not that the food or service is all that bad, I'm eating my barbacoa bowl as I type and it tastes pretty good.  It is "meh" because it cost $10 with guac and tax.  To warrant that price it should taste spectacular.  It is essentially MexDonalds.  There are not many good Mex takeout style options in this FiDi neighborhood, so I might be tempted to go back some day.  Hopefully I will re-read my own review to remind myself how disappointing the experience would be.
author: Ho H.

description:
i really like chipotle.  

for someone who dared not try mexican food until my late  20s i will say i'm behind. the dr. grew up in california for the most part and is a fan of taqueria cancun which i don't mind much but i work in the fidi and well, chipotle it is.  

being vegan, i depend on avocados to live.

this being said, why this location only gets 2 stars even though i'm a fan of the food, i have come here several times for a veggie burrito or bowl and have asked for guac and have not gotten any.  

i know they're busy as the line is insane and the speed you through as fast as they can.  you tell their employees are anxious about the rabid lunch rush as beans go flying but i've managed to stand in front of the salsa/cheese/quac guy and scream at the top of my lungs "NO CHEESE, YES GUACAMOLE.  GUACAMOLE!  YES!  GUAC!"  and I've found no guac in my burrito or bowl.  I guess i turn to pay before i can see him put it on there.  

I'll make the walk to the market st. chipotle from now on.
author: Jen I.

description:
This location should be called "Chipotle 0.5".

I'm 6' tall, and in all other Chipotle locations, I always get a fair portions for what I normally order in a rice bowl. This is the only location where I have been consistently getting only HALF amount of food I normally get in all other locations. Chipotle always fill me up, but not with what this location serves.

I'm a big Chipotle fan, so two stars. However, this location deserves one star.
author: Michael Y.

description:
4 stars for Chipotle? What? And 3 for Ozumo and Tlaloc?! You may look at my reviews and think I am crazy. Let me explain.

Yes, the lines are out the door at lunch. Yes, the wind tunnel effect exists as per another review and it gets cold. 

But the quality of the ingredients is clear, and this is by far the most affordable lunch you can get in the Financial District that is satisfying and made to your specification and filling. 

The combination of price + location + plenty of great options = 4 stars, so whether it's a chain or not is irrelevant. Thank you for being in this location, Chipotle!
author: Ravi A.

description:
This place is great! Chiptole is one of the best values you can find in the expensive FiDi area. 

Really nice employees, awesome food and good portions. May get busy at lunch. I recommend ordering ahead (they have an awesome smartphone app)!
author: Setu U.

description: The worst service I have ever had!!! Guy with no hat bald and a beard which I think is a manager!!gave me an attitude while I was ordering my food.!! I should never feel unwelcomed anywhere and this was the place where I didn't feel welcomed at all!! I repeat do not go here they treat you like shit..!!
author: Micheal B.

description:
If I could give this less than 1 star, I would do it in a NY minute! I will NEVER go to this Chipotle or possibly any Chipotle again based on todays experience. I am, correction, WAS a HUGE and avid lover of Chipotle as is my company. But today as I was in line ordering my food, I caught one of the girls talking (saying something derogatory about me that I won't repeat here) to who I found out later, was an actual manager! I've witnessed her doing this to other customers in the past unbeknown to them, and me once before and I let it go. Well today I caught her red handed again and called her out on it. She denied it and then said she was talking about someone in the kitchen. The manager she made the comment to about me, confirmed it when I called it out and the manager apologized profusely. As I tried to calm down, I took the manager (Vivianna) aside to explain the chain of events that I had witnessed in the past so that she understood why I was so PO'd. She seemed genuinely interested and committed to addressing this issue. 

(As a point reference, this person was female with long dark hair and appeared Hispanic or middle eastern.)

At which point someone named Ian who was apparently the restaurant manager came over and asked what was going on. I needed to get back to my office and gave them my number in case they wanted to further follow up. I apologize for being long winded but with so many food choices in the area, people should go where they feel valued, appreciated, and treated with dignity and respect. This place IMHO is CLEARLY NOT one of them.  =/
author: Michael A.

description:
Where to start? This review isn't really about Chipotle food in general but more about this specific location.  Those who's had it before need no introduction. We all know that they're generally quite good with fresh ingredients and quality meat. They're one of the more consistent places in terms of quality which ever one you go to. 

This place just opened about a month ago and like some other reviewers, I too was very excited to see the "opening soon" sign. As some of us know that the next closest one is few blocks away on Market st. And don't even get me started on the lines at that place. Expect minimum 10 - 15 mins in line at lunch time on a normal working day. 

I walked by one day and finally it's opened! My excitement quickly died when I saw the line. A week later I walk by, wow! The line is just as long if not worse. Where did all these people have lunch before this place opened? Do they not ever get tired of Chipotle? :) You know that most of these people are repeat customers who work nearby. Is Chipotle really THAT GOOD? 

I finally set aside enough time today to prepare to stand in line no matter what. The line wasn't so bad when I got there but already out the door. I got my food quickly as usual. Most of the Chipotle lines move quickly as they're very fast and efficient. But this place is extra fast. Be prepared to be rushed and herded like sheep at this place. Yes portions are smaller than others like some reviewers said. It's understandable though if you look at amount of people in line waiting for food. They can only make them so fast! 

Don't let the 3 star review fool you though. The food quality is good as expected. Just be ready to wait if you really want it! Chipotle has a brilliant business model. If I was the owner of this place I'd be laughing all the way to the bank. 

And to the owner of Chipotle I say: More Chipotles please !
author: Bill Z.

description: Love This place normally but the people working here today were so SLOW. I took 10 times as long to get through the line. Lunch break was all spent in line.
author: Katharine M.

description: Ordered lunch for 4 people online today.  Pickup up orders, got back to the office only to find 3 of the 4 orders were incorrect.  We went all the way back, they fixed the orders and the food was cold.  Spent $50.00 and non of us were happy with our meals. Will not be returning.
author: Cheryl F.

description: The worst I've ever been to. The woman scoffed at me when I asked for a little more than the five pieces of lettuce that she gave me. I had I ask the cashier for a bag for my three bowls for my family and he was about to swipe my Togo order with a beer on it when the manager reminded him that I have to drink that in the store. Beyond ridiculous.
author: Semira M.

description: After just moving to the FiDi to start working i was excited to see that a Chipotle was across the street!! I recently went on yelp just to make sure myself and fellow coworkers were not the only ones wondering why this might be the worse one we have EVER been to. Come to find out multiple people feel the same way as us. If it weren't for being right across the way from us and a lot of places closing down shop early I would recommend to stay away from this location. I have to ask for double meat EVERY time i go in and yes that's "$1.65" extra and still they give me just an additional half a spoon full of chicken. I POLITELY asked the young lady at the counter who was really nice why they give out smaller portions for double meat than most Chipotles do on a reg. serving? She replied with "Our Manager watches camera and measures meat contents at the end of our shifts" WHHAAATTT??? ARE YOU KIDDING ME? They bigger fella in there with the black hair was pointed out as a manager and i had remember him calling out his employee in front of everyone about serving size bc she put in "to much meat" and made her take it out. I mean this is crazy you cannot run your store like this. So I really hope whoever is in charge of reading these reviews does something about this service and management team at this location because it is AWFUL!! IT IS NOT THE EMPLOYEES FAULT THAT THEY WERE NOT TRAINED PROPERLY!
author: R D.

description: poor service. messy. and no chips? wtf? no thanks McDonalds idea of Mexican food. - barf.
author: Jacob D.

description: SLOW. Probably the slowest Chipotle I've been to. Otherwise, the usual goodness you expect from Chipotle.
author: Jimmy B.

description: Food and experience was awful. Ordered 2 different Veggie burritos' and an order of chicken tacos today. They did not label which veggie burrito was which, so we had to cut one open to see, which does not make for easy burrito eating. Then, halfway through eating my vegetarian burrito, a huge chunk of meat appeared in the luke warm mess. How did that get there? They used the same spoon to scoop out the meat as the veggie fillings? A stray hunk of meat just found its way into the veggie toppings? Either way, it's gross, not sanitary and not okay. If you are vegetarian (and even if you are not), don't bother. Orale Orale is practically next door, go there for some authentic Mexican food that's warm and actually vegetarian.
author: K K.

description: A few years ago I didn't think this was anything great but I give this location 4 stars for a healthy lunch that I can grab nearby. The menu does get boring so I only eat here about once a week. Go early or late to avoid the long line.
author: Stevo L.

description: I generally avoid Chipotle, but I went in today with friends to try the tofu burrito and give it a chance. Frankly, Chipotle has some great ingredients, but it is all doused with salt. I couldn't eat it. I ate about one third of the burrito and threw the rest away. The rice was salty, the tofu mixture was way too salty, and that combined with the salt in everything else they put on it, is just too much. They have managed to take something that could be great - a spicy tofu sofrito, and ruin it with too much salt, making healthy ingredients unhealthy in the process. If all you taste is salt and not the real food, what's the point. I love the organic Hodu soy. It's the best. But why ruin it with so much salt??
author: k w.

description: one of the worst managed businesses i've ever been to.  Consistently run out of basic items on the line like chicken, veggies, etc.  Customer service is pretty abysmal as well.  This is in the bottom floor of my building and i consistently walk past this to go to the Rubios three blocks away.  Great service there and far superior quality of food.
author: Shawn C.

description: I eat at Chipotle restaurants about 200 times per year.  And, I've been in nearly every one in San Francisco.  This new one....at 50 Sacramento Street......is by far the worst one yet.  Unfriendly and inconsistent service.  Tiny portions of meat....and I mean really stingy portions.  I asked the server, and she said that the manager does a daily count of portions-per-orders, and reprimands the servers if they try to give the customer more.  That is really bad service, cutting corners to make a buck for the bottom line.  The other restaurants have much better customer service and robust food portions.
author: Donally H.

description: I love Chipotle.  This one left me wanting a little though.  The employees were friendly but the portions were much smaller than the others I've been to.
author: J M.
